headline: Assessing Abbott Laboratories (ABT) Valuation After Q4 2025 Earnings Miss And Softer 2026 Guidance
summary: Abbott Laboratories (ABT) is back in focus after its fourth quarter 2025 earnings, where revenue of US$11.46b missed Wall Street expectations and softer guidance for Q1 2026 triggered a sharp share price reaction. headline: Abbott expects to return to ‘positive growth’ in nutrition in 2H26
summary: Says Worldwide Nutrition sales decreased 8.9% on a reported basis and 9.1% on an organic basis in the fourth quarter. Results in the quarter reflected the impact of lower sales volumes compared to the prior year and new strategic price actions targeted to increase volume growth in the future. In addition to these strategic price actions, Abbott (ABT) expects to increase volume growth with the launch of several new products in 2026. headline: Heard on the Street Thursday Recap: Spice Trade
summary: Markets drifted higher amid uncertainty about next steps for a potential Greenland deal touted by President Trump.  The Nasdaq composite gained 0.9% and the Dow Jones Industrial Average added 306 points, or 0.6%.  The Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure held steady.

headline: Abbott Laboratories: Buy This Dividend King On Sale Now
AbbVie Dodged a Patent Disaster, and Shares Gained 460%. Merck and Bristol Myers Are Next.
summary: AbbVie extended the patent life on Humira for years, enough time to more than replace the sales. Now Merck and Bristol Myers Squibb face similar patent cliffs.

headline: ABT Q4 Deep Dive: Nutrition Weakness and Innovation Shape 2026 Outlook
summary: Healthcare product and device company Abbott Laboratories (NYSE:ABT) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025 as sales rose 4.4% year on year to $11.46 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.50 per share was in line with analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Podcast: Stocks Rise as Tariff Tensions Cool
summary: The gains occur as investors look for more details about President Trump's desire to annex Greenland. Plus, Intel predicts further losses next quarter in an after-hours earnings report. And shares in Abbott Laboratories fall after the company misses sales expectations.
